title: Analyzing the Impact of Educational Video Settings on Mathematics Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using online learning tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in actual classroom settings using BYOD (Bring Your Own Device), analyzing learning outcomes through comparative experiments. Participants are randomly assigned to experimental and control groups

learning_goals: Learners can measure a difference of over 15% in math concept memory accuracy between the experimental group (real classroom environment video) and the control group (white background video).
Learners can quantitatively analyze the impact of video settings on problem-solving application ability.
Learners can derive three or more memory-enhancing strategies based on learning contexts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
